so in in Pottery any Potters anybody
ever use a potter's
wheel this is impressive numbers it's
usually maybe one I did pottery from the
time I was in like e8th grade all the
way through college and loved it our
first dishes were ones that I made and
we didn't have any money so we just used
them and and we still use them sometimes
but there are some interesting processes
in pottery and I think for people who
have done this they understand this in a
way but I just want to give you a few of
them and um maybe this will put some
things into perspective when you when
you begin to uh form something again
starts with something in your
imagination you don't just grab a clump
of clay and like hope it into something
you think about what do I actually want
to make today and and so you usually
start with a little pot you know
something real small mine would get
messed up when I was in junior high so
they were all candle holders
it's just a fancy candle holder but what
you have to do is there they would bring
clay in and it would be and ours was
always in a big wooden box and you'd go
over and you dig out the amount of clay
that you thought you needed for the
project you've chosen to make so when
you would dig out that clay they would
do something uh my teacher and in high
school was not as wonderful as my
teacher in college who was a Japanese
man so imagine he was so good at it and
he'd say I need you to spiral wedge your
clay which means you take the clay and
throw it on this board with like it's
almost like a canvas over it and you
begin to push down and and almost knead
it like you would D but Clay is not that
pliable it's a little hard I had great
muscles in college and and you would do
that and my my professor said and you
need to do it at least 100
times because if you don't you will not
work out all the impurities inside of
the clay you are working through
problems it's going to take time time
but it's worth it that's what he always
told us what number are you on it'll be
worth it and so you would hit that clay
and you'd push push it and and just
press on it because if there were any
air pockets in it there was going to be
trouble later on the second that's the
second thing we did the third thing we
take it to the wheel and the best you
could you'd throw it right into the
center of that wheel you try to get it
as close to the middle as possible
because you know that you're going to
have to have it balanced in order to
make anything worth taking home and what
you would do is you would you would
throw it down with so much
pressure so that it would stick to the
wheel because if it didn't stick it was
going to fly off and that is just
embarrassing is embarrassing I know
because it's happened a and so we do
that and then the fourth thing you would
apply pressure to every side you'd turn
the wheel on real slow you'd work it
with well the first one I had was not
electric so you had to pump that thing
with your leg so I had leg muscles too
and so uh you put some water on the clay
to keep it pliable and you would start
to push and you would put pressure I'd
actually have to like sit down and you'd
put your arms inside your legs so that
you could use your legs and your arms to
put enough pressure on that clay to get
it to quit kicking against your hands
and it to obey your hands do you see
what the Lord's trying to do with us you
ever feel like you've been going through
the same thing maybe a hundred times you
ever feel like there's so much pressure
why am I getting squeezed on every side
he's just working some impurities out of
you he's just getting you fit to be a
vessel of
Honor applying pressure and then you
begin to shape it you use a gentle
pressure and now what you were doing
from the outside all this pressure from
the outside you start to do from the
inside you put your thumbs down into the
middle of that clay and you begin to
apply pressure and you begin to start
pulling that clay out to the side until
the opening gets the size that you want
it to be and sometimes I think we feel
this e external pressure and we're a
little bit used to it because we live in
this world and the world is always
pressing on us and it's always pushing
and trying to get you to to move and to
do different things but then God does
